Type of work flexibility provided (to employee)
column2: Employer allows all or most employees (percent)

column1: FLEX TIME AND PLACE
Periodically change starting and quitting times
within some range of hours
Change starting and quitting times on a daily
basis
Compress workweek by working longer hours on
fewer days for at least part of the year
Work some regular paid hours at home occasionally
Work some regular paid hours at home on regular basis
CHOICES IN MANAGING TIME
Have control over when to take breaks
Have choices about and control over which shifts
to work
Have control over paid and unpaid overtime hours
REDUCED TIME
Move from full time to part time and back again while
remaining in same position or level
Share jobs
Work part year (work reduced time on annual basis)
CAREGIVING LEAVE
Return to work gradually after childbirth or adoption
TIME OFF
Familly or personal time off without loss of pay
Compensatory time off program
Do volunteer work during regular work hours
FLEX CAREERS
Phase into retirement by working reduced hours over
time prior to full retirement
Take sabbaticals (paid or unpaid for six months or more)
Take paid or unpaid time off for education or job
training skills
Take extended career breaks for caregiving or other
personal or familly reasons
Receive special consideration when returning to the
organization after an extended career break
